Sengketa Stadion, YOSS Gugat Pemprov Sulsel ke PTUN Makassar
06 Nov 2019, 12:27 by Muhammad Nur Abdurrahman
Makassar - Yayasan Olahraga Sulawesi Selatan (YOSS) menggugat Pemerintah Provinsi Sulawesi Selatan (Sulsel) di Pengadilan Tata Usaha Negara (PTUN) Makassar, terkait sengketa pengelolaan Stadion Andi Mattalatta di kawasan Mattoanging, Makassar.
Kuasa hukum YOSS, Hasan dalam keterangan pers di kompleks GOR Andi Mattalatta, Rabu (5/11/2019), mengatakan pihaknya telah mendaftarkan gugatan di PTUN Makassar dengan Nomor Perkara 119/G/2019/PTUN-MKS, terkait surat perintah Pemprov Sulsel pada KONI Sulsel, yang mencabut mandat pengelolaan stadion dari KONI Sulsel ke YOSS, tahun 1985 lalu.
"Setelah gugatan kami diterima di PTTUN, maka Pemprov Sulsel tidak bisa seenaknya menggunakan kekuasaanya untuk mengusir YOSS dari stadion, selama belum ada putusan tetap dari pengadilan," ujar Hasan yang turut didampingi Ketua I YOSS Andi Bahar Makkasau dan kuasa hukum lainnya.
YOSS selama ini mengklaim menguasai kawasan olah raga Mattoanging, yang terdiri dari stadion, kolam renang, gedung olahraga, dan sejumlah aset olahraga lainnya, dengan dasar sudah menguasai lahan di atas 20 tahun, dengan maksud iktikad baik, sesuai PP No 24 tahun 1997 tentang pendaftaran tanah.
Selain itu, YOSS juga memiliki surat perjanjian dengan Pemkot Makassar tahun 2001 lalu, yang ditanda tangani pendiri YOSS Andi Matalatta dan Wali Kota Makassar saat itu, Amiruddin Maula, terkait hak pengelolaan stadion.
"Yang menjadi persoalan Pemprov mengklaim memiliki sertifikat, sementara Pemprov sebelumnya tidak pernah menguasai lahan ini sebelumnya,"
Hasan menambahkan, kliennya akan berusaha mempertahankan dengan cara apa pun, jika Pemprov Sulsel mencoba merebut paksa stadion dan mengusir pihak YOSS dari Mattoanging, dengan alasan akan melakukan renovasi stadion.
"Pemprov harus menjadikan hukum sebagai panglima, tidak boleh melakukan cara-cara premanisme mengusir YOSS, kalau berani mengusir kami berarti mereka melawan negara," pungkas Hasan.
Selain gugatan di PTUN Makassar, pengurus YOSS juga memasang papan bicara di dalam lingkungan kawasan olahraga Mattoanging, yang menyebutkan tanah dan bangunan di kawasan Mattoanging tetap dikelola YOSS dan di bawah pengawasan tim pengacaranya.

Stadium dispute, YOSS Sues South Sulawesi Provincial Government to Makassar Administrative Court
Nov 6 2019, 12:27 by Muhammad Nur Abdurrahman
Makassar - The South Sulawesi Sports Foundation (YOSS) is suing the South Sulawesi Provincial Government (South Sulawesi) in the Makassar State Administrative Court (PTUN), related to the dispute over the management of the Andi Mattalatta Stadium in the Mattoanging area, Makassar.
YOSS's attorney, Hasan in a press statement at the GOR Andi Mattalatta complex, Wednesday (11/5/2019), said that his party had registered a lawsuit in the Makassar Administrative Court with Case Number 119 / G / 2019 / PTUN-MKS, related to the South Sulawesi Provincial Government's order on KONI Sulsel, which revoked its stadium management mandate from KONI Sulsel to YOSS, in 1985.
"After our lawsuit was accepted at PTTUN, the South Sulawesi Provincial Government cannot arbitrarily use its power to expel YOSS from the stadium, as long as there is no permanent verdict from the court," said Hasan who was also accompanied by YOSS Chairperson Andi Bahar Makkasau and other legal counsel.
YOSS has claimed to control the Mattoanging sports area, which consists of stadiums, swimming pools, sports buildings, and a number of other sports assets, on the basis of having controlled the land for more than 20 years, with the intention of good faith, in accordance with PP No 24 of 1997 concerning registration soil.
In addition, YOSS also had an agreement letter with the Makassar City Government in 2001, which was signed by YOSS founder Andi Matalatta and the then Mayor of Makassar, Amiruddin Maula, related to stadium management rights.
"The problem is that the Provincial Government claims to have a certificate, while the Provincial Government has never controlled this land before,"
Hasan added, his client would try to defend in any way, if the South Sulawesi provincial government tried to forcibly seize the stadium and expel the YOSS from Mattoanging, on the grounds of going to renovate the stadium.
"The provincial government must make the law as the commander, may not resort to methods of thuggery to expel YOSS, if we dare to expel us it means they are against the state," Hasan concluded.
In addition to the lawsuit at PTUN Makassar, the YOSS management also installed a talk board in the environment of the Mattoanging sports area, which said that land and buildings in the Mattoanging area were still managed by YOSS and under the supervision of his lawyer team.
